result.markdown:
--- title: "`diffobj`: Compare two dfs (or other objects)" date: 6/25/23 categories: - dataframes format: html: toc: true --- What's the difference between two `df`s? `diffobj::diffPrint()` gives a handy visual way to check differences: ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_f637eadf0e2e683b17e3d825c2bb25cc'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(diffobj) a <- b <- matrix(1:100, ncol=2) a <- a[-20,] b <- b[-45,] b[c(18, 44)] <- 999 diffPrint(target=a, current=b) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` < a > b @@ 17,6 @@ @@ 17,7 @@ ~ [,1] [,2] ~ [,1] [,2] [16,] 16 66 [16,] 16 66 [17,] 17 67 [17,] 17 67 < [18,] 18 68 > [18,] 999 68 [19,] 19 69 [19,] 19 69 ~ > [20,] 20 70 [20,] 21 71 [21,] 21 71 [21,] 22 72 [22,] 22 72 @@ 42,6 @@ @@ 43,5 @@ [41,] 42 92 [42,] 42 92 [42,] 43 93 [43,] 43 93 < [43,] 44 94 > [44,] 999 94 < [44,] 45 95 ~ [45,] 46 96 [45,] 46 96 [46,] 47 97 [46,] 47 97 ``` ::: :::
(In RStudio, this is shown in a colorful manner in the Viewer) ![](diffobj-rstudio.jpg){width="400"}
This also works for other types of objects, such as character vectors: ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_03d0dc9d3a9e315c1be192acc7920490'} ```{.r .cell-code} diffPrint(letters[1:3], c("a", "B", "c")) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` < letters[1:3] > c("a", "B", ".. @@ 1 @@ @@ 1 @@ < [1] "a" "b" "c" > [1] "a" "B" "c" ``` ::: ::: For more details, see the [Introduction to diffobjj vignette](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/diffobj/vignettes/diffobj.html), or the [diffobj github rep](https://github.com/brodieG/diffobj).

─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` setting value version R version 4.3.1 (2023-06-16) os macOS Ventura 13.4.1 system
